meals.name: Mediterranean Egg Scramble with Feta and Spinach
meals.short_description: Fluffy scrambled eggs folded with tangy feta, nutrient-rich spinach, and bright sun-dried tomatoes, served with whole wheat toast.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet and sauté spinach until wilted.
Add sun-dried tomatoes and cook for 1 minute.
Whisk eggs with a pinch of salt and pepper; pour into the skillet.
Scramble the eggs until mostly set, then gently fold in the crumbled feta.
Serve immediately alongside toasted whole wheat bread.

meals.name: Grilled Chicken Pesto Power Bowl
meals.short_description: A vibrant and satisfying grain bowl featuring juicy grilled chicken, nutty quinoa, fresh arugula, and a homemade basil pesto dressing.
instructions: Season chicken breast and grill until fully cooked. Let rest and slice thinly.
Prepare the dressing by mixing pesto with lemon juice.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, cherry tomatoes, diced cucumber, and arugula.
Top the bowl with sliced grilled chicken.
Drizzle the pesto dressing evenly over the ingredients and toss gently before serving.

meals.name: Pan-Seared Salmon with Lemon-Dill Yogurt Sauce and Roasted Sides
meals.short_description: Flaky, omega-rich salmon perfectly seared, complemented by a tangy, fresh dill sauce and hearty roasted sweet potatoes and crisp green beans.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Dice sweet potato and toss with 1 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
Roast sweet potatoes for 15 minutes. Add green beans to the tray and roast for another 10-15 minutes until tender.

Pat the salmon dry, season with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat and sear salmon skin-side down for 4 minutes, then flip and cook until done (about 3 more minutes).
Mix Greek yogurt, fresh dill, lemon zest, and a small squeeze of lemon juice to create the sauce.
Serve the salmon immediately over the roasted vegetables, drizzled with the lemon-dill sauce.
